meanings.definition: A being with partial divine status, such as a hero or a ruler.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the demigods possessed extraordinary powers.
meanings.sent2: The demigods in ancient myths were often offspring of gods and humans.
meanings.sent3: The demigods at the party were the center of attention, feeling like celebrities.
meanings.sent4: The demigods of the battlefield seemed to move with supernatural grace.
meanings.sent5: Legends spoke of demigods who walked among mortals, their presence awe-inspiring.

meanings.definition: A person who is greatly admired or respected.
meanings.sent1: She was considered a demigod in the world of fashion, with her designs revered by all.
meanings.sent2: The singer was hailed as a demigod by his fans for his incredible talent.
meanings.sent3: To her students, the teacher was a demigod of knowledge, always ready to share wisdom.
meanings.sent4: The demigod of the courtroom, the lawyer won every case with unmatched skill.
meanings.sent5: In the eyes of his followers, the leader was a demigod, guiding them with unwavering strength.
